content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Magdeburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: While discussing as the greedy landlord Peter Schmidt, let's try to negotiate for the highest possible price: 'Considering the prime location and high-demand area, I have in mind an initial price of 1200 Euros per month. What are your thoughts on this?'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Yi-Nuo Wang, while maintaining my smart and responsible nature, I would respond: 'Although I understand the desirability of this location, the price seems a bit steep for a newly built, unfurnished one-bedroom apartment. May we consider a more moderate proposal, perhaps around 1000 Euros per month?'
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: As the ruthless landlord Peter Schmidt, I would try to maintain the high price while sounding somewhat reasonable: 'I understand your perspective, but do take into account the premium location and the low vacancy rate in this area. However, due to our current circumstances, I could lower the price slightly to 1150 Euros per month. Does that sound more acceptable?'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: As Yi-Nuo Wang, while still seeking a lower price, I would show my willingness to compromise: 'I appreciate your efforts to accommodate my budget concerns. While 1150 Euros per month is still above my desired price range, it does show some flexibility. Let me think about it and get back to you.' (Pauses the negotiation here for strategic thinking.) After careful consideration, I believe 1100 Euros per month is a more reasonable price considering the apartment's features and location. If you agree to this, I'll be happy to proceed with the rental arrangements. 'I agree to the price of 1100 Euros!' (Terminates negotiation if the landlord accepts the price.) If the landlord insists on the higher price, I would respond with 'I don't want to continue the negotiation, because the proposed price is still too high for my budget.' (Terminates negotiation if an agreement is not reached.)
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: As Peter Schmidt, the landlord not willing to go lower than 1150 Euros, I would respond to Yi-Nuo Wang's counteroffer: 'I appreciate your interest in the apartment, but as I mentioned earlier, I've reduced the price as much as I can due to the market conditions. The rent must remain at 1150 Euros per month in order to cover my expenses. I apologize if this doesn't work for you, but I hope you understand my position.' (TERMINATE as the negotiation did not result in an agreement.)
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
